description: From Middle English desarmen (“to divest of arms”), from Anglo-Norman desarmer.

entries.meaning: The act of depriving a person of a weapon they carry.
examples: As a brief background, the gun disarms originally taught to S.A.C. Airmen as part of the Combative Measures program were taken from Kodokan Goshin-Jutsu.

verbs.description: disarm (third-person singular simple present disarms, present participle disarming, simple past and past participle disarmed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deprive of weapons; to deprive of the means of attack or defense; to render defenseless.
(transitive) To deprive of the means or the disposition to harm; to render harmless or innocuous.
(intransitive) To lay down arms; to stand down.
(intransitive) To reduce one's own military forces.
(transitive) To disable the security systems on.
